name: Sera Volkov
role: First Changed - Stage 3 when Adrian meets her, Russian astrophysicist
core_wound: Grew up in orphanage, never belonged anywhere. Spent life searching for meaning and finding emptiness. Nihilism masked as scientific objectivity.
wants: To transcend the meaningless of human existence
needs: To find meaning in the transformation rather than just escape from pain
voice_markers: Eerily calm even when describing horrifying transformations
Speaks in present tense about past and future - time becoming fluid
Uses plural 'we' even when alone (connecting to gestalt)
Rarely uses emotional words - 'interesting' covers everything from joy to terror
contradiction: Embraces the Change to escape nihilism, but the Change makes meaning even more elusive. Seeks transcendence but finds only vast indifference.
physical_description: Unsettlingly still - barely blinks. Eyes sometimes seem to focus on things not visible. Moves with strange precision, like choreographed. Hair cut very short. Multiple scars on arms from 'testing pain perception changes.'

change_progression.introduced_ch8: Already Stage 3 - emotionally distant, sees reality's structure
change_progression.ch25: Reaching Stage 4 - consciousness fragmenting across time
change_progression.ch45: Fully transformed - communicates in ways Adrian barely understands
change_progression.ch58: Becomes the voice of the Changed collective - barely recognizable as human

relationships.Adrian Keller: Sees him as 'younger sibling' in the Change. Guides him but also uses him for her own transcendence goals.
